Midterm Project

In my last semester of undergraduate study, I took a course called "Data Science for Finance," which applies data science concepts in analyzing financial data. For the course's midterm project, we attempted to answer the question, "what types of firms were hurt more or less by covid?" The work for my project is below.



Final Project

The course's final project was open-ended. My group and I decided to create a website

In 2021, I completed my IBE Capstone project, which involved working with other IBE students to develop a virtual reality learning curriculum for special needs individuals. We worked with a local community center's digital makerspace to design an effective curriculum for the community. We performed extensive research in both the community as well as among industry professionals throughout the country. Professionals with special needs teaching experience assisted us in figuring out the logistics of hosting such a program. Finally, we presented our plan to the community center's board of directors.

As part of my Web Systems Programming course in the fall semester of 2020, my classmates and I were tasked with building a Blackjack web application. The assignment was a test of our understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and required us to use a Deck of Cards API to manage the deck, animations for the cards, and an opponent that operated based on a set of rules given by the professor. Play the game using the link below. Enjoy!

Note: This web app was designed for desktop/laptop only. Mobile and tablet views may not look right.

); } export default Projects;
